titlestmt.subtitle: Inventory of Records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Connecticut State Library staff.

publicationstmt.p: Copyright Â© 2010 by the Connecticut State Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on August 04, 2009

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: Public Utilities Commission records
did.abstract: The Public Utilities Commission began on September 9, 1911. In 1975 it became the Public Utilities Control Authority.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: In 1911, the General Assembly established the Public Utilities Commission by consolidating the duties of the railroad commissioners and the inspector general of gas meters and illuminating gas. Its responsibilities included nearly all public power, transportation and communication facilities. In 1975, the General Assembly created the Public Utilities Control Authority from the former Public Utilities Commission. In 1979 this became the Division of Public Utility Control in the Dept. of Business Regulation and in 1980 was made an independent department called the Dept. of Public Utility Control.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series 1. Record Books, 1911-1946, include Commission decisions, findings, and orders issued in response to petitions, applications, and appeals made by corporations, municipalities, and individuals. The record books for steam railroads and street railways also include permissions to run special trains and statements of inspection.

Series 2. Annual Reports from Companies, 1911-1949, contain information on but not limited to the following: the organization, directors and officers, stockholding, areas of operation, finances, freight moved, equipment owned.

Series 3. Docket Maps, 1869-1949, bulk 1911-1941, are of projected rights of way and changes to established lines, grade-crossing elimination plans, blueprints for stations and bridges, both for railroads and street railways.
Series 4. Special Commission for the Investigation of Problems Relating to the Street Railways, 1918-1919, include two volumes of hearing transcripts and exhibits.

Series 5. Dockets, 1911-1988, has three subseries: rail, bus and taxicab livery, and index cards. Rail dockets include applications and petitions along with findings and orders, as well as accident investigation reports. Bus and taxicab livery dockets contain primarily applications and decisions concerning routes and fares. Some of the bus and livery dockets date to the time of the Public Utilities Commission's successor agency, the Public Utilities Control Authority. The index cards provide an access point to both the rail and the bus and taxicab livery dockets.
Series 6. Daily Log Books, 1948-1976, is comprised of 35 volumes that record hearings held and documents issued.
Series 7. Miscellaneous records, 1911-1924, is comprised primarily of correspondence, petitions, and receipts.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into seven series as follows:

Series 1. Record books, 1911-1946, is arranged by type of company and then chronologically. Companies include: steam railroads and street railways; electric, gas, telephone, telegraph, water and exp.; jitneys or motor vehicles; taxicabs; trucking.

Series 2. Annual reports from companies, 1911-1949, is arranged by type of company and then chronologically. Companies include: jitneys; motor bus operators; motor truck operators; railroad and express companies; street railways; taxicab operators. Not all years are present for each type of company.
Series 3. Maps, 1869-1949, bulk 1911-1941, are arranged numerically.
Series 4. Special Commission for an Investigation of Problems Relating to the Street Railways, 1918-1919.

Series 5. Dockets, 1911-1988, is arranged in three subseries: rail regulatory dockets, bus and taxi livery dockets, and docket index cards. Rail regulatory dockets are arrranged by docket number. The bus and taxi livery dockets are also by docket number beginning with box 7 except for the last box. The docket index cards are arranged by town and then by docket number.
Series 6. Daily log books, 1948-1976, are arranged chronologically.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p:

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Series 3, Docket Maps, was previously part of RG 089, Dept. of Transportation as Series 18, Rail Regulatory Docket Maps.
Series 5, Dockets, accession 1985-008, was previously part of RG 089, Dept. of Transportation as Series 15, Rail Regulatory Dockets.
Series 5, Dockets, accession 1985-009, was previously part of RG 089, Dept. of Transportation as Series 16, Bus and Livery Dockets.

did.unittitle: Series 1. Record books
Organizational matters

scopecontent.p: Includes approvals of forms for annual reports; correspondence; resolution honoring Goeorge M, Woodruff, May 5, 1930; list of Public Utitilities Commission employees since 1911 with titles, dates of employment and remarks (deceased or resigned), July 1, 1933; minutes; and appointments.

The listing also include maps, charts, and blueprints submitted pre-1911 to the Board of Railroad Commissioners as well as those removed from RG 041:001, Board of Railroad Commissioners, Series 3 and 5 during processing.
